claim: Recombinant HA antigens produced using BEVS have been shown to induce significantly higher levels of broadly cross-reactive antibodies against highly conserved regions of HA compared with egg-derived vaccines.

extracted_evidence.quote: Comparative immunogen i city of recombinant influenza hemagglutinin (rHA) and trivalent in activated vaccines (TIV) among persons > 65 years old. Vaccine 2009 28 379 85.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This reference points to a published study directly comparing the immunogenicity of recombinant HA (produced using BEVS) and egg-derived vaccines, which is relevant to the claim about differences in antibody responses.

extracted_evidence.quote: Influenza A virus vaccines containing purified recombinant H3 hemagglutinin are well tolerated and induce protective immune responses in healthy adults.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote supports the claim by stating that recombinant HA vaccines (produced using BEVS) induce protective immune responses, which implies effective antibody induction.

extracted_evidence.quote: Recom- bin ant baculo virus influenza A hemagglutinin vaccines are well tolerated and immunogenic in healthy adults.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote affirms that BEVS-produced recombinant HA vaccines are immunogenic, supporting the claim that they induce strong antibody responses.

extracted_evidence.quote: Evaluation of a recombinant hemagglutinin expressed in insect cells as an influenza vaccine in young and elderly adults.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This reference describes a study evaluating recombinant HA (insect cell/BEVS) vaccines, which is directly relevant to the claim about their immunogenicity compared to egg-derived vaccines.
